intro: Peltastes macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered peltastes, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
